comments.body:
Debated, figured someone with a RESTClient might want to know whether it's using old rules or not.  I had all optional fields as public, and required fields as hidden... but then Codec is public so people can access it.  I guess I could move that to a method...

----- Original Message -----

> > -   // namespaceInPath controls if URLs should encode the namespace as path
> >   param instead of query param
> > -   // needed for backward compatibility
> > -   namespaceInPath bool
> > -   // LegacyBehavior controls if URLs should encode the namespace as a query
> >   param,
> > -   // and if resource case is preserved for supporting older API conventions
> >   of
> > -   // Kubernetes.  Newer clients should leave this false.
> > -   LegacyBehavior bool
> 
> Should this be exported?
> 
> ---
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
> https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/pull/3269/files#r22624128
ah it's for reading... OK, that makes sense.
Would it be more useful to send back the status as an int? I mean we might want to know other statuses in the future and adding a bool for each is not good.

Agree... Hrm

> On Oct 15, 2014, at 9:10 PM, Daniel Smith notifications@github.com wrote:
> 
> In pkg/client/restclient.go:
> 
> > @@ -76,7 +76,7 @@ func NewRESTClient(baseURL *url.URL, c runtime.Codec) *RESTClient {
> >  }
> > 
> >  // doRequest executes a request against a server
> > -func (c *RESTClient) doRequest(request *http.Request) ([]byte, error) {
> > +func (c *RESTClient) doRequest(request *http.Request) ([]byte, bool, error) {
> > Would it be more useful to send back the status as an int? I mean we might want to know other statuses in the future and adding a bool for each is not good.
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
Since this is an internal api I think we can update in the future when we have more to return
